questions.question: This is the first time I ................................ a concert.
questions.description: We use the present perfect tense in expressions beginning with this is the first/second/third/last etc.'

questions.question: This is ................................. gift I have ever bought.
No one has seen him .......................... January.
questions.description: We use 'since' with the starting point of something.

questions.question: She succeeded at ....................... very first attempt.
I injured ........................ while playing football yesterday.
questions.description: We use the reflexive pronoun (myself, himself, herself etc) when the subject and the object of a verb refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: Be a responsible citizen and ......................... your taxes.
questions.description: When you pay taxes you are giving a certain amount of money to the government. When you pay for something, you are giving money in exchange for something.

questions.question: I have .............................. the drinks.
questions.description: When you pay taxes you are giving a certain amount of money to the government. When you pay for something, you are giving money in exchange for something.

questions.question: He hadn't ........................ his fee, so he could not write the exam.
questions.description: When you pay taxes you are giving a certain amount of money to the government. When you pay for something, you are giving money in exchange for something.

questions.question: Who .............................. the dinner?
questions.description: When you pay for something, you are giving money in exchange for something. For example, you can pay for the tickets, drinks or meals.

questions.question: If the rain .......................... I could take the dog out for a walk.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would / could + infinitive in the result clause.

questions.question: If I knew who did it, I .......................... his leg.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would / could + infinitive in the result clause.

questions.question: He ran as ....................... as he could.
questions.description: Quick is an adjective. Quickly is the adverb.
